sprint_goal: Establish the core application shell, basic calculation functionality, and foundational user registration/login flows with legal compliance.
Implement the full suite of trigonometric functions with robust error handling and support for engineering notation.
Deliver persistent user data by implementing calculation history and user-defined variables for registered users.
Complete the core data management features by implementing full memory functions (M+, M-, MR, MC) and variable management (list, edit, delete).
Finalize the core scientific calculator feature set by adding remaining math functions, constants, and undo/redo capabilities.
Build the foundational framework for Custom Modes, including the creation wizard (steps 1 & 2), the management list view, and backend persistence.
Implement the core logic for the Custom Mode feature by building the formula editor with real-time validation.
Complete the Custom Mode lifecycle by enabling users to launch, use, edit, and delete their creations.
Launch the first set of Advanced Electronics Features: the Ohm's Law calculator and the Resistor Combination tool (Series & Parallel).
Deliver a robust offline experience by implementing service worker caching and automatic data synchronization for registered users.

Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance by implementing comprehensive keyboard-only navigation and screen reader compatibility across the entire application. (Note: High point total may require splitting this work across two sprints).
Finalize compliance and support features, including GDPR/CCPA data export, account deletion, and a searchable in-app help system.
